Verses.Text:
5 He grew up like a tender shoot,
a root from arid ground;
In him no majesty of form,
no beauty could be found.

6 Rejected and despised was he
in suffering and pain;
We hid our faces from the sight,
with horror and disdain.

7 But surely he took up our pains,
our sorrows he has borne;
Yet we esteemed him cursed by God,
afflicted, pierced and torn.

8 But for our sins he was condemned,
for our transgressions
bruised;
He brought us healing, peace with God,
though wounded and abused.

9 We all, like sheep, have gone astray,
we wanted to be free;
And yet the L ORD has lai d on him
all our iniquity.
